message.content:
<<<api>>>: Cipher.init
<<<code>>>: /* Derive the key, given password and salt. */
SecretKeyFactory factory = SecretKeyFactory.getInstance("PBKDF2WithHmacSHA256");
KeySpec spec = new PBEKeySpec(password, salt, 65536, 256);
SecretKey tmp = factory.generateSecret(spec);
SecretKey secret = new SecretKeySpec(tmp.getEncoded(), "AES");
/* Encrypt the message. */
Cipher cipher = Cipher.getInstance("AES/CBC/PKCS5Padding");
cipher.init(Cipher.ENCRYPT_MODE, secret);
AlgorithmParameters params = cipher.getParameters();
byte[] iv = params.getParameterSpec(IvParameterSpec.class).getIV();
byte[] ciphertext = cipher.doFinal("Hello, World!".getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8));
/* Decrypt the message, given derived key and initialization vector. */
Cipher cipher = Cipher.getInstance("AES/CBC/PKCS5Padding");
try{cipher.init(Cipher.DECRYPT_MODE, secret, new IvParameterSpec(iv));}
catch(Exception e) {System.out.println("Something went wrong.");}
String plaintext = new String(cipher.doFinal(ciphertext), StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
System.out.println(plaintext);
<<<explanation>>>: The issue may be with the initialization of the `rsacipher` object. Make sure that the `rsacipher` object is properly initialized with the RSA private key before using it in the `CipherInputStream`. Also, ensure that the RSA private key is valid and correctly loaded from the `privateKey` byte array. Additionally, check if the input file `in` contains the correct encoded key.
